title: Government and Citizenship Basics

vocab.definition: The group of people who make laws and run a country, state, or city
A person who belongs to a country and has rights and responsibilities
A type of government where people vote to choose their leaders
A rule that everyone in a community must follow
The leader of a city or town
The highest law of the United States that sets up the government and protects rights
Money people and businesses pay to the government to fund public services
A group of citizens who decide facts in a court case
A responsibility citizens should do, like serving on a jury
A process where people vote to choose leaders or decide issues
To make a choice in an election
Freedoms protected by laws, like free speech
Things citizens should do, like follow laws and help the community
A service the government provides for everyone, like schools, roads, or parks
Government for a city or town that handles local services
Government for a state that makes statewide laws
Government for the whole country that handles national issues

teachingNotes: Connect to school rules and classroom government. Discuss voting and decision-making. Use examples from local government.
